title: How to borrow books from the library - Quora

response.answer_text: You need a library card first. Take some form of ID and proof of residence to your local library and it’s free—a piece of mail addressed to you is sometimes enough. Fill out the forms (Library staff will help you if you need it) and get the card with your patron ID Number. Find the book you want by browsing the shelves or looking things up in the catalog (Library staff will help if you need it) . Take your book to the circulation desk where a worker will scan your card and your book. Some libraries have self-scanners too. Your library number/barcode gets you access to a lot of other things. Printing and scanning services, computers, e-books, streaming video, etc.

You go to the library and ask for borrowing privileges. You fill out a membership card and they enter you intothe system along with an agreement to abide by the rules and standards of that library. The will scan your library card and then scan the books and that way they know what books you have out.
